data.text: @whstancil This is just a poll showing more people believe the lab-leak hypothesis, in spite or because of your attempts to exorcise it.  In fact, none of these items are egregious and only someone with rigid, self-defeating ideas about earning trust would find them objectionable.

@ScottBrincat @whstancil Quite the opposite. ZERO evidence has been provided that the virus did not leak from the lab, which is basically a certainty in statistical terms. This is at this point widely accepted as the most likely explanations by governments and intelligence.
@xiruxi @whstancil @joshrogin He’s not a big fan of Trump tho, but a rabid China hawk
@uscutxp0 @whstancil @mattyglesias @jonathanchait @joshrogin Almost a rule of thumb at this point if you see the hacks align.
@xeno_swift @whstancil @joshrogin Absolutely. He pushed this hard based on his misleading claims about state department cables. Republican water carrier.
@whstancil China ‘said’ these farms were shut down right away. For some reason. #OneHealth https://t.co/6N6UaMoTSa

@whstancil It is NOT the product of a lab leak because: A virus code name "yunnan Jade" was taken from WIV on 18th Sept 2019 in a military vehicle, transferred to cold food chain vehicle, taken to the site of the Wuhan Military Games and delivered.  A VAX was already being developed....
